paragraphs.text: %md # xtra tutorial: Working with Oracle Data Visualization Desktop and Spark This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.3.3-20 as part of the New Data Lake User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: Note: This tutorial assumes you have tables defined in the Hive metastore which you should have if you ran the earlier tutorials. Oracle Data Visualization Desktop ( here ) is a lightweight, single-file download tool to easily analyze data. Data Visualization Desktop can connect to a variety of data sources. In this tutorial, we will show you how you can use it to securely connect to BDCS-CE. We will connect via DV Desktop's support for Spark. Please follow the instructions in the xtra Connecting DV Desktop and Hive for the DVD download and install instructions.

msg.data:
xtra tutorial: Working with Oracle Data Visualization Desktop and Spark

This tutorial was built for BDCS-CE version 17.3.3-20 as part of the New Data Lake User Journey: here. Questions and feedback about the tutorial: david.bayard@oracle.com

Note: This tutorial assumes you have tables defined in the Hive metastore which you should have if you ran the earlier tutorials.

Oracle Data Visualization Desktop ( here ) is a lightweight, single-file download tool to easily analyze data. Data Visualization Desktop can connect to a variety of data sources. In this tutorial, we will show you how you can use it to securely connect to BDCS-CE. We will connect via DV Desktop’s support for Spark.

Please follow the instructions in the xtra Connecting DV Desktop and Hive for the DVD download and install instructions.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Define a connection in DV Desktop for the Spark connection

+ Open up DV Desktop
+ Click on Data Sources
+ Click on Connection (Under Create)
+ Click on Spark
+ Enter the Connection Name
+ Enter the Host Name/IP for your BDCSCE instance.  The port should be the Thriftserver port for this instance. The default is 10015.
+ Set the Username to the admin username you use to sign-in to your BDCSCE cluster/notebook (the default username is bdcsce_admin)
+ Set the Password to the admin password you use to sign-in to your BDCSCE cluster

![DVDconnection](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey2-new-data-lake/images/300/DVDSparkconnection.bmp "HODBC")

msg.data:
Define a connection in DV Desktop for the Spark connection

  • Open up DV Desktop
  • Click on Data Sources
  • Click on Connection (Under Create)
  • Click on Spark
  • Enter the Connection Name
  • Enter the Host Name/IP for your BDCSCE instance. The port should be the Thriftserver port for this instance. The default is 10015.
  • Set the Username to the admin username you use to sign-in to your BDCSCE cluster/notebook (the default username is bdcsce_admin)
  • Set the Password to the admin password you use to sign-in to your BDCSCE cluster

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Create a DV Desktop Data Source for your connection

+ Invoke the pop-up menu on your new Data Source and choose Create Data Source
+ Navigate through the database, tables, and columns to choose the elements you want to add.
+ Name the new data source and Add it

![DVDdatasource](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/oracle/learning-library/master/workshops/journey2-new-data-lake/images/300/SparkDataSource.jpg "HODBC")

msg.data:
Create a DV Desktop Data Source for your connection

  • Invoke the pop-up menu on your new Data Source and choose Create Data Source
  • Navigate through the database, tables, and columns to choose the elements you want to add.
  • Name the new data source and Add it

name: xtraOLD Connecting DV Desktop and Spark
